titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Anderson Graduate School of Management. Reports. 1961-1973.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by University Archives staff, 1987 November; finding aid revised by Katharine A. Lawrie, 2013 July; machine-readable finding aid created by Katharine A. Lawrie, 2013 July.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-07-09T14:51-0700

did.unittitle: Anderson Graduate School of Management. Reports.
did.abstract: Record Series 192 contains reports generated by or in association with UCLA's Anderson Graduate School of Management.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. Advance notice required for access. Contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Copyright of portions of this collection has been assigned to The Regents of the University of California. The UCLA University Archives can grant permission to publish for materials to which it holds the copyright. All requests for permission to publish or quote must be submitted in writing to the UCLA University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Anderson Graduate School of Management. Reports (University Archives Record Series 192). UCLA Library Special Collections, University Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Record Series 192 contains reports generated by or in association with UCLA's Anderson Graduate School of Management. Reports regard the undergraduate degree program, annual Dean's reports, and urban environments including South Central Los Angeles. This collection also includes 11 reports of the Mexican-American Study Project (MASP), project directed by Anderson faculty Leo Grebler.
This is an active record series; additional University records are expected to be added.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volumes 1-11 of reports from the Mexican-American Study Project (MASP); Leo Grebler served as project director of MASP. These copies of the reports were formerly UCLA University Archives Reference copies.
